candidates.title: switch rusoto to aws_sdk_cloudwatch
candidates.body:
switch over to aws-sdk as rusoto is no longer updated.
new limits for number of metrics, etc, from [the docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_PutMetricData.html) (at the time of writing, at least)

Since the aws-sdk uses a concrete `Client` type rather than rusoto's `Cloudwatch` trait, i had to wrap it in a trait to allow mocking and test.  this does mean that technically clients could still use a rusoto client if they take care to adjust the types.

candidates.title: Fix the benchmark and some minor tweaks
candidates.body: Reverts https://github.com/ramn/metrics_cloudwatch/pull/29 since it inevitably slows down shutdown which is problematic. An intermediary commit fixed the issue in the benchmarks but I think it is better to just not do it at all.

candidates.title: feat: Update the metrics crate to 0.15
candidates.body:
BREAKING CHANGE

Users should update their metrics version to 0.15 or metrics will not be
reported

candidates.title: feat: Allow rustls to be used over native-tls
fix: Make gauges display the current value as "Average"
candidates.body:
With multiple tasks submitting to the same gauge the `Average` would
then be the average of the tasks which is probably the best we can do.

Alternatively we could record `sample_count` and submit `sum: sample_count *
current` but it probably makes more sense to get one "sample" per task,
instead of one sample per call to `gauge!` (?)

candidates.title: feat: Update to metrics 0.13
candidates.body:
Since metrics 0.13 now support sending increment and decrement to
gauges, the "sum" in `StatisticSet` now tracks the current value as the
sum does no longer make any sense (it didn't really make sense before
either).

repo.name: metrics_cloudwatch
repo.description: CloudWatch emitter for the metrics crate
